result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were canceled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jordan M. Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(c).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(c).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Obscenity, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions for Counts 2, 3, and 4:  

Submit to psychological evaluation as ordered/directed by agent.

Submit to AODA if so directed by agent.

Seek and maintain full-time employment or full-time educational programming (school).  If not in a full-time school program, seek work at the rate of five jobs per week with agent to track that until the defendant is employed.

One set of costs ordered in this case, including the DNA surcharge, assessed on Count 2 only.

Defendant to submit to DNA sampling at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before reporting to probation.

(Defendant has a felony diversion agreement with the District Attorney on Count 1.)

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as Count 2 but NO COSTS.
Concurrent with: Count 2

Same conditions as Count 2 but NO COSTS.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 and 3

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan M. Hicks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jordan M. Hicks in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution.  Per the DA, waiver of prelim needs to occur; then, def will be pleading G/NC to all four counts of the information - 1 count stalking plus 3 counts re computer message w/threats, etc.  DA is recommended a 5 yr diversion agreement on Count 1.  On Counts 2-4, DA asks for sentence to be withheld for probation of 2 years with conditions that def undergo any psych. or AODA assts or treatments as requested/directed by agent; seek work/education as required/recommended by agent; costs of action.  

Prelim waiver colloquy.

Def pleads guilty to all four counts.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Counsel address the Court.  DA not asking for expungement.  Atty. Whitney addresses the Court.  Court adopts the agreement of the parties and orders the diversion agreement for 5 years.  Judgment withheld on 2-4 for probation with psych. evaluation as ordered/directed by agent.  AODA as up to agent.  Seek work at rate of 5 jobs/wk with agent to track until def is employed; or full-time school.  So work or school.  One set of counts ordered - apply to count 2.  Expungement is not a possibility.  Def to submit to RCSD for DNA sampling.
Def waives right to prelim.  Prelim waiver colloquy.

Defendant Jordan M. Hicks in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Further status as likely plea/sentencing requested and set for April 23 at 10:30.  Status conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jordan M. Hicks
Current: 145 W 7th St., Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 04-06-2015)
Prior: 145 W. Seventh Street, Richland Center, WI 53581

Defendant Jordan M. Hicks in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states parties need more time; asks for continuation.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jordan M. Hicks in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA asks for additional status; parties are working towards resolution.  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jordan M. Hicks in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. W states he was appointed by the SPD; just received the complaint today.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights.  Status requested and set.  Prelim time limits have been waived.  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
